short_summary: Waste Removal Services for Forillon National Park
description: Waste Removal Services. Waste removal and removal of recyclable and compostable materials at the Forillon National Park. Contract period will start on April 1, 2024, and will end on March 31, 2026. The Contract also includes an irrevocable option for the option from April 1, 2026 to March 31, 2027.
full_summary:
Tender Announcement
**Waste Removal Services / Forillon National Park**
**Services d’enlèvement des matières résiduelles / Parc National Forillon**

**Reference Number:** cb-22-79360539
**Solicitation Number:** 5P300-23-0296/A
**Publication Date:** 2024-02-21
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-03-21T14:00:00

**Summary:**
Parks Canada is seeking a service provider for waste removal and recycling services at Forillon National Park. The successful bidder will be required to collect and dispose of waste and recyclable materials in accordance with the National Park Act.

**Notice to Bidders:**

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted.
* Parks Canada is not currently accepting bids via SAP Ariba. Tenderers must submit their bid via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.
* Bids received in-person or by courier will not be accepted.

**Quoting Instructions:**

* Only the following email address will be accepted for responses to the bid solicitation: soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca.
* Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

**Important Dates:**

* Request for Proposal: 2024-02-21
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-03-21T14:00:00

**Evaluation Criteria:**

* The bid will be evaluated based on the lowest price submitted.

**Documents:**

* Bidder’s Offer: Should be submitted in the form of a tender with all supporting documentation.
* Administration of Quotations: Should be in accordance with the General Conditions of Contract.

**Inquiries:**

* All inquiries must be made in writing and should be received no later than five (5) calendar days prior to the date set for solicitation closing to allow sufficient time to provide a response.

**Regulations and Requirements:**

* All work is to be performed in accordance with the National Park Act.
* Bidders that consider themselves qualified to provide this work and intend to submit a bid should obtain documents from the Government Electronic Tendering Service.

**Documents and Downloads:**

* https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/32547/rfq-5p300-23-
